name: Auto CVE & IOC Feed Ingestor with OpenAI Risk Triage & Email Alerts

user.name: Adnan Tariq
user.bio:
Founder of CYBERPULSE AI ‚Äî helping security teams and SMEs eliminate repetitive tasks through modular n8n automations. I build workflows for vulnerability triage, compliance reporting, threat intel, and Red/Blue/GRC ops. Book a session if you'd like custom automation for your use case.

https://linkedin.com/in/adnan-tariq-4b2a1a47

description:
## How it works  
This Blue Team workflow ingests threat intelligence from public CVE and IOC feeds, merges the data, performs automated triage using OpenAI, and routes actionable alerts via email.

- üì• CVE and IOC feeds pulled from trusted sources  
- ü§ñ AI node evaluates risk severity and recommends response  
- üß† Playbook logic determines whether to notify, monitor, or isolate  
- üìß Alerts sent to email and also logged to Google Sheets  
- üß± Built with modular, no-code logic for maximum clarity  

## Set up steps  
1. Add your OpenAI API key in the AI nodes  
2. Configure your email in the Gmail node  
3. Update Google Sheets credentials and sheet ID  
4. (Optional) Add a Cron or Webhook trigger to automate intake

## Requirements  
‚Ä¢ OpenAI API key  
‚Ä¢ Gmail credentials  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets access  
‚Ä¢ Internet connection

## Who‚Äôs it for  
‚Ä¢ Blue teamers  
‚Ä¢ SOC analysts  
‚Ä¢ Cybersecurity students  
‚Ä¢ SME defenders using no-code tooling  

---

This template is part of the CYBERPULSE AI BlueOps Lite & Pro plans.  
Visit [cyberpulsesolutions.com/blueops](https://www.cyberpulsesolutions.com/blueops) for the full bundle.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
